description:
SlideOver component displays content in a panel that slides in from the edge of the screen.
It's useful for secondary content or actions that don't require leaving the current page.
name: SlideOver

tags.name: example
tags.text:
Basic usage
<SlideOver
label="Panel Title"
open={isOpen}
onClose={() => setIsOpen(false)}
>
<Text>Panel content goes here.</Text>
</SlideOver>

tags.name: example
tags.text:
With subtitle
<SlideOver
label="Edit Profile"
subtitle={<Text type="caption">Update your personal information</Text>}
open={isOpen}
onClose={() => setIsOpen(false)}
>
<VStack spacing={16}>
<Input label="Name" value={name} onChange={(e) => setName(e.target.value)} />
<Input label="Email" value={email} onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)} />
</VStack>
</SlideOver>

tags.name: example
example
tags.text:
With bottom actions
<SlideOver
label="Create Item"
bottomActions={
<>
<Button variant="standard" onClick={() => setIsOpen(false)}>
Cancel
</Button>
<Button variant="primary" onClick={handleSave}>
Save
</Button>
</>
}
open={isOpen}
onClose={() => setIsOpen(false)}
>
<Text>Form content</Text>
</SlideOver>

tags.name: example
example
tags.text:
Full window width
<SlideOver
label="Detailed View"
fullWindowWidth
open={isOpen}
onClose={() => setIsOpen(false)}
>
<Text>This panel takes the full window width.</Text>
</SlideOver>

tags.name: example
tags.text:
With complex content
<SlideOver
label="Shopping Cart"
subtitle={<Text type="caption">3 items</Text>}
bottomActions={
<>
<Button variant="standard" onClick={() => setIsOpen(false)}>
Continue Shopping
</Button>
<Button variant="primary" onClick={handleCheckout}>
Checkout
</Button>
</>
}
open={isOpen}
onClose={() => setIsOpen(false)}
>
<VStack spacing={16}>
{items.map(item => (
<Card key={item.id}>
<Text>{item.name}</Text>
<Text>${item.price}</Text>
</Card>
))}
</VStack>
</SlideOver>
